DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a lymph node confirmed by pathologic means.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to confirmed lymph node.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Small, bean-shaped organs located along the channels of the lymphatic system. The lymph nodes store special cells that can trap bacteria or cancer cells traveling through the body in lymph. Clusters of lymph nodes are found in the underarms, groin, neck, chest, and abdomen. Also called lymph glands.

Concepts.definition: A bean-shaped organ surrounded by a connective tissue capsule. It is part of the lymphatic system and is found throughout the body. It is composed predominantly of lymphocytes and its main function is immune protection.

Property.preferredDefinition: Confirmed; having been established or verified.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: At least one pathologically c
ReferenceDocuments.description: At least one pathologically confirmed positive lymph node identified

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must have a breast primary >= 2.0 cm and/or one or more biopsy-positive lymph nodes

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have positive para-aortic lymph nodes confirmed by PET/CT scan, fine needle biopsy, extraperitoneal biopsy, laparoscopic biopsy or lymphadenectomy

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the nodal status confirmed by PET/CT scan, fine needle biospy, laparoscopic biopsy or lymphadenectomy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is there pathological evidence of regional lymph node involvement?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have positive para-aortic lymph nodes confirmed by PET/CT scan, fine needle biopsy, extraperitoneal biopsy, or laparoscopic biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have pathologically positive axillary nodes at any time including of pN0(i+) or pN0(mol+) ypN0(mol+) disease?
